## Do something simple

```{r}
set.seed(1)
x_vec = rnorm(30, mean = 5, sd = 3)

(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)
```

I want a function to compute z-scores

```{r}
z_scores = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("Input must have at least three numbers")
  }
  
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)

}

z_scores(x_vec)
```

Try my function on some other things. These should give errors.

```{r, error = TRUE}
z_scores(3)
z_scores("my name is jeff")
z_scores(mtcars) # you can't take means of a dataset
z_scores(c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE)) # force to be 1,0
```

## Multiple outputs

```{r}
mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("Input must have at least three numbers")
  }
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  tibble(
  mean = mean_x,
  sd = sd_x
  
  )

}
```

Check that the function works

```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(100, mean = 3, sd = 4)
mean_and_sd(x_vec)
```

## Multiple inputs

I'd like to do this with a function

```{r}
sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n = 100, mean = 4, sd = 3)
  )

sim_data %>%
  summarize(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )
```

translate into a function

```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(samp_size, mu = 3, sigma = 4) {
  
  sim_data =
    tibble(
     x = rnorm(n = samp_size, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
    )
  
  sim_data %>%
  summarize(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )
  
}

sim_mean_sd(samp_size = 100, mu = 6, sigma = 3) # position matching vs. name matching sim_mean_sd(samp_size = 100...)
sim_mean_sd(mu = 6, samp_size = 100, sigma = 3)

sim_mean_sd(samp_size = 100)
```
